problem_text: G. Higman proved that, for any prime number p, there exists a natural number χ(p) such that the nilpotency class of any finite group G having an automorphism of order p without non-trivial fixed points does not exceed χ(p). At the same time he showed that χ(p) ⩾ (p2 − 1)/4 for any such Higman’s function χ. Find the best possible Higman’s function. Is it the function defined by equalities χ(p) = (p2 − 1)/4 for p > 2 and χ(2) = 1? This is known to be true for p ⩽ 7. V. D. Mazurov
